record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name="config" and term="UNIX disk configuration" and format.name="config.file" and syslanguage="en"
record.recordid: config - UNIX disk configuration - config.file - en
record.file.name: config
record.format.name: config.file

brief.brief: Use this form to maintain standard UNIX disk file records.
There must always be a record, with a configuration item name of "database load/unload.unix", in this file. Service Manager uses it to load and unload files in P4 format.

detail.detail: The formats raw, binary, text binary, and text are P4 special formats, used by the database load and unload functions. Use the raw format when creating a "file" config record to read or write non-P4 formats.
r=read; w=write; a=append: Indicates whether to read, write, or append to a file.
